title.narrative: OP 1. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) POLICY, PLANNING & MONITORING

description.narrative: : National and Subnational line ministries and departments have strengthened political commitment, accountability and capacity to develop and adopt evidence based equitable and gender-sensitive policies, budgeted plans for scaling up of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions to promote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016 children's health and development will benefit from equitable and sustainable access to, and use of, safe water and basic sanitation, with particular emphasis on reaching rural remote areas

participating-org.narrative: PROVINCIAL EDUCATION SERVICE AND SPORT SAVANNAKHET PROVINCE

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: : National and Subnational line ministries and departments have strengthened political commitment, accountability and capacityto develop and adopt evidence based equitable and gender-sensitive policies, budgeted plans for scaling up of WASH interventions topromote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices.

description.narrative: The draft overarching WASH policy for urban and rural settings has been finalized and under process of endorsement by the Government. The Vice Minister of Health led the Lao delegation and participated in the SWA ministerial meeting in Addis Ababa in March, 2016. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2017

title.narrative: of updated research / studies supporting equity and gender sensitive approaches made available

actual.value: 2016:21) Sanitation Supply Chain Study jointly with WSP/WB, SNV and Plan Laos (2014), and 2) WASH Evaluation (2015)

title.narrative: of manuals and guidelines available for use

actual.value: 2016:3 1) O&M Manual for WASH in Schools, 2) English version of Raising Clean Hands in Lao PDR. 3) Rural Water supply guideline

actual.value: 2016:Draft WASH sector policy in the process of endorsement by the government.
